intro: Ceropegia huillensis subsp. flava, commonly known as the yellow ceropegia, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly found in regions of Peru and Bolivia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its trailing stems and tubular, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are pollinated by specific insect species, and it is often cultivated for its ornamental value. The subspecies flava is distinguished by its pale yellow petals and contrasting green stems.
